Ijtikri traits vary based on where the individual developed, granting a +2 species bonus to a skill, as well as a spell-like ability usable once per day. Caster level equals the ijtikri’s level or CR. The skill and spell-like ability are as follows:

  • @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.racial-features.9oEWTLFCw0pEWj7J]{Mineral Signature, Indigo}: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.5h3iePfJaeQMc3Qr]{Stealth},@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.WVlj6EuKGCrjozBH]{Keen Senses}
  • @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.racial-features.5CcgoU2WQ2AxwRRB]{Mineral Signature, Crimson}: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.1tzIBDaDAO4hmX5C]{Diplomacy}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.Q9W1JWVHI9iq2R6y]{Share Language}
  • @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.racial-features.05ztcn6iaxJvFYoC]{Mineral Signature, Gray}: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.UDTsEIldhXTn0VJA]{Survival}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.dIlKtUGGKcur6OaK]{Wisp Ally}
  • @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.racial-features.dGMPSFhpGRpOJKyX]{Mineral Signature, Colorless}: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.nBrYkGfNBJAHe0xJ]{Sense Motive}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.2l5Xk1YMzp0hlUok]{Life Bubble} NS 
  • @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.racial-features.bvExGQMEGBR71Sz7]{Mineral Signature, Emerald}: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.tVUA3IPcOfyU1g19]{Life Science}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.PVzsrE1TxBBjDLCa]{Command} NS 
  • @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.racial-features.ocnqprqMUnKV7sE2]{Mineral Signature, Gold}: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.d4fcGwOcrsuYrwGH]{Medicine}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.wMBxnYkNbzWJklIB]{Remove Condition} NS 

Source NS pg. 131

Ijtikris take up a signature from the environment they developed in, causing differing structural manifestations and coloration. Those not raised on Vesk-2 can be bathed in admixtures that mimic their home world’s environment. Otherwise they might develop unique traits based on the local environment. The following are a few alternative mineral signatures, each of which alters the mineral signature species trait.

Colorless: An ijtikri raised in an area that lacks as much environmental input as might occur on Vesk-2 develops pale, translucent skin and a bone-colored mantle. Such an ijtikri gains a species bonus to the Sense Motive skill and life bubble as a spell-like ability.

Emerald: Ijtikris with an emerald signature have an intuitive sense of the workings of living things. They gain a species bonus to the Life Science skill and command as a spell-like ability.

Gold: The gold signature is much more rare, and ijtikris often see it as a blessing of the sun. They gain a species bonus to the Medicine skill and remove condition as a spell-like ability.
